item.title: Dragon Fly DB: The Database of Choice for Modern Enterprise Applications 👨🏼‍💻
item.description: As businesses continue to embrace digital transformation, the demand for high-performance and scalable database management systems has increased significantly. In recent years, Dragon Fly DB has emerged as one of the most popular choices for modern enterprise applications. In this blog post, we will discuss why Dragon Fly DB is the database of choice for modern enterprise applications and showcase some code examples in Golang, Java, and C#. Dragon Fly DB is an open-source, distributed database system that is designed for high-performance and scalability.

item.title: Understanding a fair comparison between Cassandra MongoDB and MySQL 👨🏼‍💻
item.description: When choosing between Cassandra, MongoDB, and MySQL, it’s important to consider the specific requirements of your project and how each database management system (DBMS) meets those needs. Here are some points to consider when deciding which DBMS to use: ➜ Data model : Cassandra and MongoDB are both NoSQL databases, which means they use a non-relational data model. This can be beneficial for handling large amounts of unstructured data, or for storing data with complex relationships.
